column5: port-ly
Omg !!!! Looking at that picture makes it hard for me to keep MY pants clean !
Wow. Thats an absolute beast.
Most definitely  Beauty fish Cheers Rick
I believe that the word "corpulent" may be more appropriate. HH

Beauty, nice that there is now some lakes open after the traditional end of Sept closer, they do colour up real pretty in spawning  season. My years in Haliburton , took a few late Sept weeks holiday when the partridge opening week and the last week of specs overlapped, but they were not in full colour yet.
Awesome !
Chuck is putting on a clinic as usual! That's a handsome specimen.
wow ... !!! dignified specimen for sure !!!!
That thing is a tank!
What a monster!
That is a beauty  Chuck. Under a slip float ? LOL  Very nice.
Beautiful fish ! Looks like you got some on you .
that is no smoked chub, that is a giant, hats off, great catch !
Daaaaaang dude!!! That there's a purdy one!

OMG was my 1st reaction. I have only even seen a few Speckled Trout in my life and were the size of that beasts tail. I thought I would see a pic of Mr. Bunk holding that behemoth. Photo shop? You both have a resemblance. Older bro? That's a compliment Charles.
here's a better, close up picture of Chuck when he's not all bundled up-
Thats not Chuck, thats Jason McCoy from the road hammers. LOL.

Awesome speck! The larger ones can be a tough nut to crack late in the fall, but they dont come much prettier than that. Heres a little smaller one from a week back.  When you get lucky with a warm sun and calm winds in late fall you can end up having a bit of a feeding frenzy.
Thanks Guys.  That's a beauty hen there Joey.  But I don't recall any nice days this fall lol and it seems like it's already over. Lol B, if I don't see you at the ice show, I'm mailing those floats.
I,ll be there both days Chuck, and got those fly's still.
Beauty fish chuck... lets go back up that dirt road again next year to see if we can find some  more like that !
what a beast! nice one!
